title: Civil Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Manitoba in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: the interview was held in the manager's office, which was very friendly environment all questions were about my resume and some general questions. i could answer all questions very well and after 1 week I could get a job offer
Interview Questions: what are your weaknesses and strengths?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Manitoba
Interview Descriptions: The interview was mainly questions about past experience. You should be ready to apply some methods concepts to examples in the interview. Three people took turns asking questions and there was a brief prepared written piece ahead of time. This could be an existing project or publication.
Interview Questions: How past research experience applied to the content area of the job. how this job would help to contribute to overall career goals.

title: Service Desk Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Manitoba (Toronto, ON) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Interview time was mainly used by the panel asking questions. They left no time for candidate to ask questions, nor did they offer for the candidate to ask questions. 

They sent a pre work packet and asked for it to be completed and sent back prior to interview date, and during interview they openly stated that they did not read it. Not sure what the point of this was!

They stated response would be sent out to the candidates 7 business days from the interview date. No response until 15 days later, and no response from the admin people when I sent a request for an update.
Interview Questions: describe how you think u of m support would be different than your current company (they would not accept any answer I gave, insisting that u of m support would be wildly different, without allowing me to explain)

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Manitoba
Interview Descriptions: Pretty chill, more like a chat for 45 mins. Some questions and testing about excel. Basically, they handed me their computer and asked me to perform certain operations on excel. Overall, a good interview as well as working experience.
Interview Questions: Describe your knowledge in excel

title: Marker/Grader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Manitoba
Interview Descriptions: Apply for the jobs online, and one of the Hr would send you an email. I don't really remember about that. I don't really remember about that. I don't really remember about that.
Interview Questions: I don't really remember about that.

title: Ph D Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Manitoba
Interview Descriptions: Some of the technical questions were tough, but there were more behavioural questions. Then I sent my documents including transcripts, and IELTS results to the faculty of graduate studies, and after a few months I received my admission letter ...
Interview Questions: Did you have prior experience in vehicle dynamics and control? what's your experience with stability analysis, and dynamical system theory?  Have worked with Lyapunov exponents as a tool for stability analysis? are you familiar with nonlinear control system design?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Manitoba
Interview Descriptions: First through email asking for a resume and the names of two references. Then we had a meeting on skype asking about my experience and resume. Overall, it was fine and friendly.
Interview Questions: What was your previous research experience?

title: Russian Language TA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Manitoba in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very informal and was conducted by the instructor. I've spent 40 minutes just chatting and we hardly talked about anything job-related. The instructor was more interested in getting to know me personally rather than trying to figure out whether I can do the job-related duties.
Interview Questions: - can you name Russian cases in English?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Manitoba
Interview Descriptions: the interview was basically online and via email and phone, cause i was applying for a RA position overseas. Since my advisor sucks so he didn't really give any good Qs academically but relentlessly bragging about himself.
Interview Questions: what is your education background

title: Graphic Designer for the Manitoban Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Manitoba
Interview Descriptions: Two people interviewed me for about 10 minutes or less because I was not fully prepared back then, nor did I had enough time to prepare so it was pretty short. But I was fully capable of the job, as I finished something much more complicated later, which was my practicum with 130+ pages of texts and graphics. So people, do prepare well for the interview!
Interview Questions: What is there to be improved about the layout of the Manitoban?

title: Food Server Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Manitoba in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Group Interview,  just written interview. it is around 15 questions, take maybe one hour. Then you need to prepare deposit infomation, available working time  and reference together. Then you have to wait till one week to one month to know the result.
Interview Questions: how to handle emergency situation, time-management, employee relationship

title: Engineering Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Manitoba (Winnipeg, MB) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a formal interview at one of the university meeting rooms.  A group of 5 people from the  UM were the committee.  All the questions were based on the job posting and my resume.
Interview Questions: Everything was based on my resume. My skills and hands-on experience.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Manitoba
Interview Descriptions: I did not have an interview, as I was invited to work by my employer. As such, I recommend that those individuals who are interested in having this job network with professors.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Manitoba (Winnipeg, MB) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: just asked standard questions. it was annoying that they didn't let me know the results of the competition. there were 3 people interviewing me. it lasted about an hour. i felt comfortable.
Interview Questions: how does your experience relate to this position

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Manitoba (Winnipeg, MB) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Today, many companies have an involved interview process starting with screening interviews, which often take place on the phone, followed by in-person interviews, second interviews, and even third interviews. In addition to a hiring manager, you make meet with managers, employees, and other staff.M
Interview Questions: Why teaching?

title: Farm Team Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Manitoba (Toronto, ON) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty short interview because they had a few important questions they needed to ask and then they offered me the job. This was probably because of a lack of applicants. It was a good experience overall.
Interview Questions: Do you have or intend to grow facial hair? You will need to where a respirator and facial hair can get in the way

title: Admissions Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Manitoba (Winnipeg, MB)
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job and I received a call for an interview shortly after.  Scheduled the interview a couple days later and heard back from them that same day.  I had to turn down the job offer for personal reasons.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a difficult customer?

title: Marker/Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at University of Manitoba (Winnipeg, MB) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Talk to professors about it, express your interests, list your academic standings, and then apply through Jump. After that, people in the computer science department will receive your application and review your application. A few weeks later, received an offer.
Interview Questions: Have you taken this course before?

title: Front Desk Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Manitoba (Winnipeg, MB) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I sat for two interviews. One with the desk staff manager and the arts undergraduate program manager. The next was with the Dean’s office boss. The first asked general questions and the next answered more specified questions to decide whether I was the right fit. I received a call a few days after the second interview informing me I got the job.
Interview Questions: How do you handle high pressure lines and doing many things at once?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Manitoba (Winnipeg, MB) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Simple ! Professor helped! Apply online. Study about the subject. You should have minimum knowldge about the the subject you are teaching and should also have good communication skills.Please find the attached advertisement for a tenure-track position in Industrial Engineering at Concordia University.
Interview Questions: Technical questions regarding the same subject!

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Manitoba (Winnipeg, MB) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Apply online first and then talk to the advisor about it.
talk to each professor about your idea and why you want to work in their lab, they will write back the email to the department advisor.
Interview Questions: what's your plan for your project

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Manitoba (Winnipeg, MB) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with manager and director of the department. Interview was an hour long, and there was only 1. Casual atmosphere in office interview, clear questions and easy to communicate my qualifications relating to the position.
Interview Questions: My experience with software, how I can use it to improve their business.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Manitoba (Winnipeg, MB)
Interview Descriptions:
Two interviews for a lowly research assistant position (level 2).  I think this was just a preference of the department I interviewed in and not the norm. Pretty demanding in my opinion.

Questions included:
1) Conflict with coworker and how you dealt with it
2) Experience publishing an article
3) Experience in providing research assistance
Interview Questions: Do you prefer working independently or with a team?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Manitoba (Winnipeg, MB) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
CV, transcript will be requested upon your application submitted.
Schedule an interview
Personal introduction about your previous academic and research background
In-depth discussion of the research areas you are interested
Describe your strength and weakness
Interview Questions: What is your strength in your research area?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Manitoba (Winnipeg, MB) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was very straight forward, contact the professor and he saw my qualifications and then offered me the offer. then, he started to help me going through the process then joined 3 months later
Interview Questions: why you are interested in this research?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Manitoba (Winnipeg, MB) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was a hiring committee. Everyone on the committee introduced themselves. Each person on the committee asked prepared questions and everyone took notes. The interview lasted about an hour. Nothing out of the ordinary.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the University of Manitoba?

title: Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Manitoba (Winnipeg, MB) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Questions are easy and straightforward. Asked some very common behavioral questions. There were two person in the interview board and they were very friendly. The interview took around 20 minutes and after that they were discussing about their programs,
Interview Questions: Why am I interested in this position?

title: Information Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Manitoba (Winnipeg, MB) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: The head of the department and another departmental executive performed an in-person interview that lasted about an hour. The atmosphere was relatively relaxed and informal. Questioning was primarily focused on knowledge-testing and assessments of interpersonal and customer service abilities. Interviewers were fairly open and responsive to applicant questions about job duties and departmental philosophies.
Interview Questions: How I would manage an IT call from someone displaying clear signs of agitation/frustration.

title: Food Service Helper Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Manitoba (Winnipeg, MB) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: this was a 1:1 process.... I was asked various questions about 50 where I had to reply and my response was written down by the interviewer,,, any question that seemed unclear to me was explained by the interviewer and I was able to provide the response.
Interview Questions: how would I use the skills I have to impact the company

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Manitoba
Interview Descriptions:
After applying online, received a call for an interview after about a month.  Met with 2 individuals, one of whom was the supervisor for this position.  Questions were asked by each interviewer in alternating format.  

Asked a lot of questions regarding how I deal with deadlines, confrontations and solving problems.  

After 1st interview, received a call for a second interview 2 weeks later.  Interviewers were the same supervisor and one team member.  Questions were more focused with scenarios and situations being defined.
Interview Questions: What would you do if someone was upset for having reached 5 other people and being transferred to you?  They are not willing to be transferred again.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Manitoba (Winnipeg, MB) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I met with the PI and he described the project I will be working on and it was more of a discussion later on. Then I was asked about the possible starting date.
Interview Questions: All the questions where research project related

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Manitoba in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I sent an email to the prof I wanted to work with, he answered and asked for transcripts.  Then after a day, he offered me a research assistantship position at U of M.
Interview Questions: Checking BSc and MSc transcripts

title: CADLab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Manitoba (Winnipeg, MB) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online via email. About two weeks later I received an interview which lasted a very short amount of time. The interview was conducted over the phone and it was mainly to verify my information and available start date. I had a strong background and a lot of experience in the field so that may have resulted in a short interview. There may have also been a small applicant pool.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with Mac OS and Windows OS?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Manitoba (Winnipeg, MB) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: There wasn't really a review process. I had asked if there were any positions available, I was told there was and would I like to apply, I said yes. They asked if they could view my transcript, they did. then I was asked when I could start.
Interview Questions: When could I start
